questions.question: What is the maximum number of bright fringes produced by a single slit diffraction?
What is the angular width of the central maximum in Young's double-slit experiment?
Which of the following statement is not correct for Fraunhofer diffraction?
options: The slit size affects the brightness of the diffraction pattern.
It occurs when a wave passes through an aperture or a slit.
It is due to the interference between two waves originating from different sources.
It produces a single bright fringe.
questions.answer: It produces a single bright fringe.

questions.question: In the Fraunhofer diffraction, what happens when the source size is increased?
options: The central maxima increases in width and intensity.
The secondary maxima increases in width and intensity.
The central maxima decreases in width and intensity.
The secondary maxima decreases in width and intensity.
questions.answer: The central maxima decreases in width and intensity.
